name: @microfox/fillout-oauth
title: Microfox Fillout OAuth
description: TypeScript OAuth package simplifying authorization and access token management for Fillout.

readme_map.title: Microfox Fillout OAuth
readme_map.description: The full README for the Microfox Fillout OAuth

all_readmes.description: Initializes a new instance of the Fillout OAuth SDK.
Generates the authorization URL for the OAuth flow.
Exchanges the authorization code for an access token.
Validates the authorization response from Fillout.
Checks if the provided access token is valid.

constructors.name: FilloutOAuthSdk
constructors.description: Create a new Microfox Fillout OAuth client through which you can interact with the API

extraInfo: To obtain OAuth credentials for Fillout:
1. Sign up for a Fillout account at https://www.fillout.com/
2. Navigate to the developer settings in your Fillout account
3. Create a new application to receive your client ID and client secret
4. Register your redirect URI in the application settings
Environment variables:
- FILLOUT_CLIENT_ID: Your Fillout application client ID
- FILLOUT_CLIENT_SECRET: Your Fillout application client secret
- FILLOUT_REDIRECT_URI: Your registered redirect URI
OAuth flow requirements:
1. Use the FilloutOAuthSdk.getAuthorizationUrl() method to get the authorization URL
2. Redirect the user to the authorization URL
3. Handle the redirect back to your application and extract the 'code' and 'state' parameters
4. Use FilloutOAuthSdk.validateAuthorizationResponse() to validate the response
5. Use FilloutOAuthSdk.getAccessToken() to exchange the code for an access token
Important notes:
- Fillout uses the Authorization Code Grant flow
- There is no explicit mention of scopes in the Fillout OAuth documentation
- The access token does not have a specified expiration time in the documentation
- There is no documented refresh token mechanism; you may need to re-authorize when the token expires
- Always use HTTPS for secure communication
- Store the client secret securely and never expose it in client-side code
Rate limits and constraints:
- The Fillout API documentation does not specify rate limits
- It's recommended to implement exponential backoff for API requests to handle potential rate limiting
For more detailed information, refer to the Fillout API documentation (URL not provided in the given context)
